title: For Trade:  WASR/AK-47 and many accesories for trade or sale
postcontent:
What we have here is the venerable WASR platform with a variety of American additions to make a reliable and versatile package. Pictured are the rifle itself, which has a Tapco trigger and grip. The stock is a MagPul MOE on a VLTOR all-metal AK-AR convertor. Fore grip is a UTG metal quad-rail covered in MagPul accessories -- positive grip and stays cool after repeated magazine dumps. On top is a Burris FastFire II, making this AK easy to aim and a pleasure to fire quickly. I also have four Tapco 28-rd mags, one ProMag drum that performs flawlessly, a MagPul single point/dual point sling with two QD attachments and one quick-release clip, a Surefure dual-mode tactical light, a Sightmark red laser, and an offset mount for either of the above. Also a sturdy bipod and a cheaper plastic AK-AR stock convertor. The flash suppressor is an AKM style. The magazines are all loaded and I can include a couple hundred loose rounds for the right deal.

This is a great platform to have fun and to build skill. It is also a very reliable and effective weapon for self-defense at close and medium ranges. The red dot adds a lot of functional accuracy. It is an AK. It is not an accurized AR10 capable of sub-MOA groups at 200 meters or more. But you knew that.

title: For Sale:  Genuine HK-91 with all the toys
postcontent:
This is what happens when you own a cherished firearm for 30 years. You continue to acquire stuff for it. For sale is my faithful fiend of 30 years, a genuine HK-91 with all the toys imaginable. The gun was purchased in the 1980s, I am the second owner to the best of my knowledge. It will eat any type of 7.62/308 ammo on the planet and shoots most of it extremely well. I have taken deer with it at over 200 yards and won many rifle range bets with it over the years as well. It will shoot 1-inch groups or better with factory ammo and good reloads. It has the folloing accesories:
-HK scope mount 30mm/1-inch ($400 many years ago)
-Recoil buffer (within fixed buttstock - $35)
-HK Ejection Port buffer ($40)
-HK Carry Handle ($45)
-HK Collapsible buttstock ($200)
-ARMS scope mount with 3-9x basic hunting scope ($150)
-Bayonet lug (difficult to find one these days - $50)
-Bayonet (commercial not surplus) ($100)
-HK bipod ($200)
-HK leather sling ($30)
-Ten (10) HK STEEL 20-rd magazines. (I've never owned an aluminum one)
-Eight (8) Thermold 20-rd magazines. I prefer these to steel for my own exploits.
-Four (4) HK steel 5-round magazines (these are the expensive ones at $50 each)

The big scope is NOT offerred with the package unless someone wants to pay a reasonable amount above the sales price of the package. It is a 30mm Springfiled Armory 1000-meter scope. Most of the magazines have some ammo in them so I'll throw that in too. I have extra parts such as the scope ring inserts for 1-inch scopes, the dust cover where the bayonet lug resides today, and extra bayonet lug (surplus), original recoil buffer, books, etc.

The gun is no longer in 100% condition. It has been in the field. The gun shows wear at the sling mount point on the front, under the selector lever and around the ejection port wear the ejection port buffer has moved slightly during extended use at the range.

I will entertain some trades, multiple gun trades, bullion and $100 bills, with cash being king.  I only check my email a few times per week, so be patient with my response. The gun alone sells for more than $2000 on gunbroker. Do your homework and you'll see this is a fantastic opportunity to own one of the best battle rifles in history.

Remington CTF Bullets are an excellent lead free bullet choice for target shooting at both indoor and outdoor ranges. CTF bullets are jacketless brass and polymner frangible bullets that disintegrate into powder fragments upon impact with hard targets without splash back, thus dramatically reducing the hazard to bystanders. Remington CTF Bullets are an excellent lead free bullet choice for target shooting at both indoor and outdoor ranges. CTF bullets are jacketless  frangible bullets that disintegrate into powder fragments upon impact with hard targets without splash back, thus dramatically reducing the hazard to bystanders. postcontent: Our # XM1063 NO MAGAZINE SALES into NEW YORK CITY This listing is for ONE magazine, but winning buyer can take any number of extras we have available at the same per-mag price and no additional shipping charges. Remington‚Äôs model 788 Bolt Action Rifle was not a looker at all, like their 700 BDL. It was, however, one of the most accurate rifles ever made. Its looks stand out, more than anything, for the detachable magazines like the ones in our photos. The 788 enjoyed production from 1967 until 1983, and variants chambered in specific calibers, with briefer runs. The .243 was manufactured in 1968 and 1980 only; 7mm-08 in 1980 only; and the .308 from 1969 until 1980. Photos show only a handful of old stock Remington 788 Magazines we found in an old West Warehouse. Manufacturer is Taiwanese, probably HFC / Keymore. Construction is blue steel body, floorplate, and cartridge follower, with polymer release lever. These magazines are manufactured on Remington Factory Equipment. Each magazine holds 3 rounds of .243 Winchester or 7mm-08 Remington or .308 Winchester caliber ammunition. These magazines Will Not Work in any other rifles except model 788 Remington chambered in one of those 3 calibers. All 3 calibers, of course, were invented from the .308 case, just with different bullets in them. Body sides are marked with the caliber, just like the last production ones made in Ilion NY were. These are excellent, well made magazines, and they work well, from numerous field reports. 788 Magazines are nearly impossible to find; this is the only show in town. We‚Äôre offering them each for only $ 39.00. Not for sale to residents of New York City. Any magazine deliveries into New York City require written permission from the Police Commissioner, so we cannot ship magazines into any of the six boroughs or 176 some odd zip codes, per NYC Code 10-131.10. title: For Sale:  Buffalo Bore Ammo - Heavy 10mm Ammo - 200 gr. F.M.J. (1,200fps/M.E. 639 ft.lbs.) - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
https://www.extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=113




Buffalo Bore Ammo - Heavy 10mm Ammo - 200 gr. F.M.J. (1,200fps/M.E. 639 ft.lbs.) - 20 Round Box







The Buffalo Bore Heavy 10 mm ammo is the result of many years of customers requests that we produce several such loads for the 10 mm.

These loads bring out the full potential of the 10mm, but operate at standard pressures and as such, are safe to use in any standard 10mm pistol. Please don't phone us and ask if these loads are safe in your 10mm - THEY ARE - provided your 10mm is a normal operating pistol in good condition.

We are using flash-suppressed powders so your vision will not be materially affected should you be required to drop the hammer in low light.

If you are firing this 10mm ammo from an autoloader and experience high extreme spreads in velocity, it is not the ammo. Here is why and how to remedy the situation.

Full power 10mm ammo has always generated enough recoil and pressure to require a pretty stiff recoil spring in your handgun - this of course depends on several variables such as your slide weight, etc. When the cartridge fires, it generates enough pressure/recoil to prematurely open your breech face in some guns. When this happens, the opening breech face has an effect on the burn rate of the powder. This can result in some fairly high extreme spreads in velocity. If you are experiencing extreme velocity spreads of more than 50 fps, simply install a stiffer recoil spring. For example, I have an original Colt Delta Elite. This gun with the factory spring runs extreme spreads of about 35fps with both of these 10mm loads. I am happy with 35 fps, so I leave the Delta Elite as is. I also have a custom built Para Ordinance with a Nowlin barrel. It runs extreme spreads of about 70 fps with its original recoil spring. When I install a spring that is 4 lbs stiffer, the extreme spread drops to about 35 fps. The new Glock model 20 comes with a recoil spring that allows the breech face to open too soon and my new Glock model 20 will get extreme spreads of about 100fps with the factory spring installed. When I go to a stiffer recoil spring, the extreme spreads drop to about 50 fps in my new Glock model 20. Of course none of this will be an issue in a revolver. None of this will be an issue in real life either, as these high extreme spreads don't hurt accuracy or function. However, I mention this because if you are like me and want things to be as correct as possible, I have outlined the problem and the solution. The industry fixed all these problems initially, by watering down the 10mm ammo over the last several years. The watered down 10mm ammo does not generate the pressure/recoil to open the breech face early. If you want the full powered 10mm ammo we make, you simply need to tweak your pistol. Or just realize that you are getting some fairly high extreme spreads and ignore it or live with it. It's not hurting any thing in reality.

Please understand that we get hundreds of emails per day. If we don't answer your email, it is not because we don't value your patronage, but it is because we simply don't have the manpower to answer so many emails. Thank you for your business. Have fun and be safe.

Please note below, my personal velocities taken from real pistols:
1.       1198 fps - Glock model 20 4.6 inch barrel
2.       1223 fps - Colt Delta Elite 5 inch barrel
3.       1244 fps - Para Ordinance 1911 with Nowlin 5 inch barrel

title: For Sale:  Pair of Hopkins and Allen Shotguns
location: East of Indianapolis, Indiana, United States
postcontent:
Hopkins & Allen Single Barrel Shotguns.  These particular shotguns were manufactured around 1902 by the Hopkins and Allen company in Norwich, Conn.  These are the last of the 'Forehand' style produced just after the Marlin Company purchase which discontinued the production line.  The pair are single action 12ga shotguns with tip-over loading action and thumb release to open the chamber.  Both guns have original matching serial numbers on their respective barrel and receiver.  The barrel lengths are 30" with steel beaded sight.  The finish is a soft patina with a unique ghosting effect developing around the edges from years of handling.  The stock and fore-end are American Walnut with a rich, warm finish.  One shotgun has the original leather recoil pad and has 6 notches on top of the stock indicating the number of successful hunts.  The other shotgun has the original recoil pad but features an embossed image of a squirrel.  Both guns would be a great addition to a private collection or as conversational pieces above the fireplace.  The shotguns are sold together, as a pair.  The specifications are below:

Overall Length:     45"
Barrel Length:       30"
Choke:                 Fixed typically modified
Length to Heel:    14-1/2"
Length to Toe:     14-3/4"
Drop at Comb:      1-3/4"
Drop at Heel:        3-3/4"

title: For Sale:  FLAG 22 AMMO POACHERS
postcontent: The 22 ammo that people are listing for way too much just came in at midway. I was lucky enough buy 2 boxes for personal use and could have bought 3 but I don't need that much to shoot. This is why we have a shortage of 22 ammo. People buy it to resell it at a inflated price. The only way to stop this is too flag these ads constantly and continue to do so. I know most of you are not stupid enough to buy the ammo at that price. Most us are avid shooters but most people who do not yet shoot start out with a 22. In order to keep people interested in becoming gun owners and therefore keeping the market saturated with new products and low prices we need work together to keep 22 ammo available. FLAG THESE PEOPLE WHO CARE MORE ABOUT PROFIT THAN THE SPORT OF SHOOTING.

title: For Sale:  Beretta Px4 Storm Full Size .40 S&W Pistol 42-JXF4F21
postcontent: The new Beretta Px4 Storm pistol is the most advanced expression of technological and aesthetic features in a semiautomatic sidearm. Built around a modular concept that a pistol can be adapted to different needs and modes of operations, without compromising on ergonomics and the renowned Beretta reliability and performance, the Px4 Storm emphasizes power, ease of handling, performance and reliability. Manufactured in three calibers, the Px4 Storm uses an exclusive Beretta designed innovative locked-breech with a rotating barrel system, the strongest action to date. The light yet durable frame employs modern thermoplastic technology through the use of technopolymer reinforced fiberglass. Modular structure, ergonomics and interchangeability of parts make the Px4 Storm the ideal firearm for law-enforcement use, as well as personal defense. Accessory Rail: The frame of the Px4 Storm has an integral Picatinny MILSTD-1913 rail for rapid attachment of tactical lights and laser aiming devices. Slide: The sides of the slide are smooth and offer snag-proof insertion and removal of the pistol from its holster. The front and rear serrations on the slide facilitate slide operation and safety control in both wet or dry conditions. Visible Automatic Firing Pin Block: The front part of the firing pin is blocked from any forward movement until the trigger is pulled completely back. The block is located rearward, far away from the fouling and debris of the breech face. Since the block is visible, the user may ascertain its proper operation at any time. Even if the pistol falls and strikes the ground muzzle down, the firing pin will not strike the primer. 3-Dot Sight System: Features a white ‚Äò3-dot‚Äô sight pattern for quick acquisition of the target. The rear sight is designed to provide a front projection so that, in an emergency, the user may retract the slide single-handedly by pushing the rear sight against the edge of a table, door, etc. Ambidextrous Safety (Type F): The ambidextrous safety lever, easily accessible by the thumb or a right or left handed shooter, is spring loaded so it‚Äôs either positively ‚Äúon‚Äù or ‚Äúoff‚Äù. The safety lever also functions as the pistol‚Äôs decocking lever. When pushed down, the rear part of the firing pin (striker) is rotated out of alignment with the front part of the firing pin. (NOTE: Type C does not have an external safety/decocking lever). Additional hammer drop catch (half cock notch) prevents striking of the firing pin unit in the remote chance of unintentional hammer drop. External Hammer Design: A traditional feature of Beretta pistols, this design provides the most energy to the firing pin, virtually eliminating the possibility of misfires due to light primer strikes. Also provides an immediate visual and tactile indicator as to the cocked/uncocked status of the pistol. Individual Size Grips: Pistol may be configured with small, medium or large backstraps to individually fit the hand of each shooter. The backstraps are checkered to ensure a firm grip in both wet or dry shooting conditions. Three backstraps included with every pistol. Magazine: High capacity steel magazines are durable and drop-free, even when empty, when the magazine button is depressed. Standard flush magazines may be complemented with optional extended magazines that increase the capacity by 3 rounds (1 round for .45 Auto caliber). Reversible Magazine Release: Multiple-sized, reversible magazine release buttons allow for customization to the individual‚Äôs hand size. Small size comes standard on the gun, while medium and large buttons are available as accessories and easy replacement. Each size may be positioned for right-handed or left-handed use. No Glare Finish: Beretta‚Äôs exclusive BrunitonTM non-reflective black coating is a superior corrosion and wear resistant finish. Simple Field Stripping: Pistol is designed for extremely quick and simple field stripping. Disassembly latch does not remove from the gun, preventing accidental dropping and loss. Reassembly is easy and accidental misassembly of parts is prevented by the distinctive design. Barrel: The Px4‚Äôs unique rotating barrel and locking system dissipates recoil energy radially, reducing felt recoil and muzzle rise. This is the strongest Beretta pistol action. Chrome lined barrels provide extreme corrosion resistance, as well as ease of cleaning. Barrels also feature a deeply recessed combat muzzle crown to protect the rifling. (NOTE: Sub-Compact models feature tilt-barrel locking system and stainless steel construction).

title: For Sale:  German G24(t) Infantry Rifle 8mm Mauser, SOLD
postcontent: This is a German Infantry Rifle (Gewher 24) that was manufactured in Czechoslovakia in 1941. The G24(t) was produced for two years only and total production numbered roughly 250,000 rifles before the plant was converted to produce the standard model 98k infantry rifle. This particular rifle is non matching and is in fair condition. The metal parts that were originally blued are heavily finish worn and have a nice aged patina. The German proofmarks are intact and unpinged on the receiver. The large Heer proof is quite clear on the receiver by the serial number. The stock is also Heer marked, but it is very faint. There is a repaired crack at the sling slot. Additionally, the stock is a laminated stock which is likely from 1942 production and it is not original to to this rifle. Production of the Gewher 24 rifles ceased in mid 1942 when the factory converted to 98k production. With the total production of only two years and 250,000 rifles, examples that remain in excellent and all matching condition are extremely difficult to find and command a significant premium. This example can be purchased at a lower non-premium price because of its condition, allowing the buyer to add a rifle to their collection that is typically missing from all but the most advanced collections. Cal 7.92x57mm with fair bore (Frosted). REF number 8651 SOLD

title: For Sale:  Iraqi Model 98 Mauser  8mm Mauser
postcontent: 1943 ce code Model 98 Rifle, manufactured for the German Military by Sauer & Sohn. After WWII ended, this rifle was reworked by the East Germans where it picked up the Crown proofs on the left side of the receiver and barrel. Finally it ended up in Iraqi service where the Jeem property marks (Triangular stamps) were applied to the top of the barrel and receiver. Rather unique, this rifle passed through three separate failed regims and ended up on the surplus market. Cal 7.92x57mm (8mm Mauser) with a fair bore. It is not a sewer pipe, but there is some leading or crud in the grooves and it may or may not improve with some range time. REF number 8649Shipping to your FFL is $35.00

title: For Sale:  Beretta Px4 Storm Full Size .45 ACP Pistol 42-JXF5F25
postcontent: The new Beretta Px4 Storm pistol is the most advanced expression of technological and aesthetic features in a semiautomatic sidearm. Built around a modular concept that a pistol can be adapted to different needs and modes of operations, without compromising on ergonomics and the renowned Beretta reliability and performance, the Px4 Storm emphasizes power, ease of handling, performance and reliability. Manufactured in three calibers, the Px4 Storm uses an exclusive Beretta designed innovative locked-breech with a rotating barrel system, the strongest action to date. The light yet durable frame employs modern thermoplastic technology through the use of technopolymer reinforced fiberglass. Modular structure, ergonomics and interchangeability of parts make the Px4 Storm the ideal firearm for law-enforcement use, as well as personal defense. Accessory Rail: The frame of the Px4 Storm has an integral Picatinny MILSTD-1913 rail for rapid attachment of tactical lights and laser aiming devices. Slide: The sides of the slide are smooth and offer snag-proof insertion and removal of the pistol from its holster. The front and rear serrations on the slide facilitate slide operation and safety control in both wet or dry conditions. Visible Automatic Firing Pin Block: The front part of the firing pin is blocked from any forward movement until the trigger is pulled completely back. The block is located rearward, far away from the fouling and debris of the breech face. Since the block is visible, the user may ascertain its proper operation at any time. Even if the pistol falls and strikes the ground muzzle down, the firing pin will not strike the primer. 3-Dot Sight System: Features a white ‚Äò3-dot‚Äô sight pattern for quick acquisition of the target. The rear sight is designed to provide a front projection so that, in an emergency, the user may retract the slide single-handedly by pushing the rear sight against the edge of a table, door, etc. Ambidextrous Safety (Type F): The ambidextrous safety lever, easily accessible by the thumb or a right or left handed shooter, is spring loaded so it‚Äôs either positively ‚Äúon‚Äù or ‚Äúoff‚Äù. The safety lever also functions as the pistol‚Äôs decocking lever. When pushed down, the rear part of the firing pin (striker) is rotated out of alignment with the front part of the firing pin. (NOTE: Type C does not have an external safety/decocking lever). Additional hammer drop catch (half cock notch) prevents striking of the firing pin unit in the remote chance of unintentional hammer drop. External Hammer Design: A traditional feature of Beretta pistols, this design provides the most energy to the firing pin, virtually eliminating the possibility of misfires due to light primer strikes. Also provides an immediate visual and tactile indicator as to the cocked/uncocked status of the pistol. Individual Size Grips: Pistol may be configured with small, medium or large backstraps to individually fit the hand of each shooter. The backstraps are checkered to ensure a firm grip in both wet or dry shooting conditions. Three backstraps included with every pistol. Magazine: High capacity steel magazines are durable and drop-free, even when empty, when the magazine button is depressed. Standard flush magazines may be complemented with optional extended magazines that increase the capacity by 3 rounds (1 round for .45 Auto caliber). Reversible Magazine Release: Multiple-sized, reversible magazine release buttons allow for customization to the individual‚Äôs hand size. Small size comes standard on the gun, while medium and large buttons are available as accessories and easy replacement. Each size may be positioned for right-handed or left-handed use. No Glare Finish: Beretta‚Äôs exclusive BrunitonTM non-reflective black coating is a superior corrosion and wear resistant finish. Simple Field Stripping: Pistol is designed for extremely quick and simple field stripping. Disassembly latch does not remove from the gun, preventing accidental dropping and loss. Reassembly is easy and accidental misassembly of parts is prevented by the distinctive design. Barrel: The Px4‚Äôs unique rotating barrel and locking system dissipates recoil energy radially, reducing felt recoil and muzzle rise. This is the strongest Beretta pistol action. Chrome lined barrels provide extreme corrosion resistance, as well as ease of cleaning. Barrels also feature a deeply recessed combat muzzle crown to protect the rifling. (NOTE: Sub-Compact models feature tilt-barrel locking system and stainless steel construction).

title: For Sale:  Beretta Px4 Storm Full Size 9mm Pistol 42-JXF9F21
postcontent: The new Beretta Px4 Storm pistol is the most advanced expression of technological and aesthetic features in a semiautomatic sidearm. Built around a modular concept that a pistol can be adapted to different needs and modes of operations, without compromising on ergonomics and the renowned Beretta reliability and performance, the Px4 Storm emphasizes power, ease of handling, performance and reliability. Manufactured in three calibers, the Px4 Storm uses an exclusive Beretta designed innovative locked-breech with a rotating barrel system, the strongest action to date. The light yet durable frame employs modern thermoplastic technology through the use of technopolymer reinforced fiberglass. Modular structure, ergonomics and interchangeability of parts make the Px4 Storm the ideal firearm for law-enforcement use, as well as personal defense. Accessory Rail: The frame of the Px4 Storm has an integral Picatinny MILSTD-1913 rail for rapid attachment of tactical lights and laser aiming devices. Slide: The sides of the slide are smooth and offer snag-proof insertion and removal of the pistol from its holster. The front and rear serrations on the slide facilitate slide operation and safety control in both wet or dry conditions. Visible Automatic Firing Pin Block: The front part of the firing pin is blocked from any forward movement until the trigger is pulled completely back. The block is located rearward, far away from the fouling and debris of the breech face. Since the block is visible, the user may ascertain its proper operation at any time. Even if the pistol falls and strikes the ground muzzle down, the firing pin will not strike the primer. 3-Dot Sight System: Features a white ‚Äò3-dot‚Äô sight pattern for quick acquisition of the target. The rear sight is designed to provide a front projection so that, in an emergency, the user may retract the slide single-handedly by pushing the rear sight against the edge of a table, door, etc. Ambidextrous Safety (Type F): The ambidextrous safety lever, easily accessible by the thumb or a right or left handed shooter, is spring loaded so it‚Äôs either positively ‚Äúon‚Äù or ‚Äúoff‚Äù. The safety lever also functions as the pistol‚Äôs decocking lever. When pushed down, the rear part of the firing pin (striker) is rotated out of alignment with the front part of the firing pin. (NOTE: Type C does not have an external safety/decocking lever). Additional hammer drop catch (half cock notch) prevents striking of the firing pin unit in the remote chance of unintentional hammer drop. External Hammer Design: A traditional feature of Beretta pistols, this design provides the most energy to the firing pin, virtually eliminating the possibility of misfires due to light primer strikes. Also provides an immediate visual and tactile indicator as to the cocked/uncocked status of the pistol. Individual Size Grips: Pistol may be configured with small, medium or large backstraps to individually fit the hand of each shooter. The backstraps are checkered to ensure a firm grip in both wet or dry shooting conditions. Three backstraps included with every pistol. Magazine: High capacity steel magazines are durable and drop-free, even when empty, when the magazine button is depressed. Standard flush magazines may be complemented with optional extended magazines that increase the capacity by 3 rounds (1 round for .45 Auto caliber). Reversible Magazine Release: Multiple-sized, reversible magazine release buttons allow for customization to the individual‚Äôs hand size. Small size comes standard on the gun, while medium and large buttons are available as accessories and easy replacement. Each size may be positioned for right-handed or left-handed use. No Glare Finish: Beretta‚Äôs exclusive BrunitonTM non-reflective black coating is a superior corrosion and wear resistant finish. Simple Field Stripping: Pistol is designed for extremely quick and simple field stripping. Disassembly latch does not remove from the gun, preventing accidental dropping and loss. Reassembly is easy and accidental misassembly of parts is prevented by the distinctive design. Barrel: The Px4‚Äôs unique rotating barrel and locking system dissipates recoil energy radially, reducing felt recoil and muzzle rise. This is the strongest Beretta pistol action. Chrome lined barrels provide extreme corrosion resistance, as well as ease of cleaning. Barrels also feature a deeply recessed combat muzzle crown to protect the rifling. (NOTE: Sub-Compact models feature tilt-barrel locking system and stainless steel construction).
